title: National Angel Family Day, 2026
summary: Proclamation 11013 of February 23, 2026, declares February 22, 2026, as National Angel Family Day. The proclamation honors victims of crimes committed by undocumented immigrants and those lost to fentanyl, emphasizing the preventable nature of these tragedies. It highlights specific cases, including Laken Riley's murder, and criticizes sanctuary policies. The proclamation details actions taken to address illegal immigration, such as mass deportations, border security measures, and the passage of the Laken Riley Act and the One Big Beautiful Bill. It claims significant reductions in border apprehensions and encounters, asserting the achievement of the most secure border in American history. The proclamation calls for an end to violence against law enforcement, stronger penalties for re-entry after deportation (Kate's Law), and renewed commitment to the rule of law and border security.
